programmes.show_description: National and international news from BBC Radio 4.
...Transformation After Trauma. 3/5. Leading forensic psychiatrist Gwen Adshead reflects on her work with survivors of trauma. Contains graphic violent scenes.
The latest weather reports and forecasts for UK shipping.
BBC Radio 4 presents a selection of news and current affairs, arts and science programmes from the BBC World Service.
National and international news from BBC Radio 4.
News, views and features on yesterday's stories in Parliament.
The latest weather reports and forecasts for UK shipping.
A spiritual comment and prayer to start the day with Paul Kerensa.
The farming minister on changes to England's biggest environmental scheme.
News and current affairs, including Sports Desk, Weather and Thought for the Day.
Misha Glenny and guests discuss the spread of plants, animals and diseases after Columbus reached the Americas in 1492 and the transformations and devastations that followed.
With the rise of AI, will they be writing history in the future? Stewart and Armando look at some recent ex-prime ministers, and how they try and shape their legacy.
Women's voices and women's lives - topical conversations to inform, challenge and inspire.
Who gets conceived, who gets to live, who gets to die and who decides? Sonia Sodha investigates the new politics of bodily autonomy.
...Transformation After Trauma. 4/5. Leading forensic psychiatrist Gwen Adshead reflects on her work with survivors of trauma.
The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.
Evan Davis hosts the business conversation show with people at the top giving insight into what matters.
What will mobile phones be like in future? Greg Foot examines the rise of future wonder products.
The latest weather forecast.
News, analysis and comment from BBC Radio 4.
9/11. Who should take responsibility for the devastating impact of side effects from dopamine agonists - drug companies, regulators, doctors?
Chelsea follows Susan's advice, and Brian is grateful to Rex.
3/6. Project Hope is taking its first steps in Branwich. But has Ayad got the staying power? State-of-the-nation drama from award-winning writer Steve Waters.
Martha Kearney visits Savernake Forest in Wiltshire.
Actor Jemma Redgrave makes the Radio 4 Appeal on behalf of Encephalitis International.
The programme that holds the BBC to account on behalf of the radio audience.
David Aaronovitch and guests discuss the war in Ukraine, four years after Russia invaded, and ask what could bring it to an end.
A weekly programme that illuminates the mysteries and challenges the controversies behind the science that's changing our world.
News and current affairs, reporting on breaking stories and summing up the day's headlines.
National and international news from BBC Radio 4.
3/4. International comedy sensation Randy Feltface is finally asking the question: how do we speed up climate change and end the planet as quickly as possible?
Brian tries his hand at matchmaking, and Helen has the time of her life.
Live magazine programme on the worlds of arts, literature, film, media and music.
David Yelland and Simon Lewis look at how different types of friends are sent to the PR front line when it comes to reputational combat.
The BBC under fire over an unedited racial slur in its Baftas coverage, Ukraine War four years on, the power of the photographic image to drive a narrative.
Stuart Maconie is joined by Lucy Beaumont, Gizzi Erskine, Alasdair Beckett-King and Jonny Balchandani.  With music from Jesca Hoop & Lail Arad performing The Songs of Joni Mitchell.
With the rise of AI, will they be writing history in the future? Stewart and Armando look at some recent ex-prime ministers, and how they try and shape their legacy.
In depth reporting, intelligent analysis and breaking news from a global perspective.
4/5. A love story based on the lives of the author's great-grandparents, who married in 1878. Contains language which some may find offensive.
The UK is one of the world's largest consumers of ultra-processed foods. Restaurateur Thomasina Miers thinks we should cut the taxes of businesses that serve healthy alternatives.

The latest news about food, farming and the countryside.
News and current affairs, including Sports Desk, Weather and Thought for the Day.
Roula Khalaf, journalist and editor, shares the eight tracks, book and luxury item she would take with her if cast away to a desert island. With Lauren Laverne.
Women's voices and women's lives - topical conversations to inform, challenge and inspire.
Shaped by centuries colonialism and challenged by climate change, what is future food for the Philippines? Dan Saladino meets farmers, producers and campaigners to hear answers.
...Transformation After Trauma. 5/5. Leading forensic psychiatrist Gwen Adshead reflects on her work with survivors of trauma. Contains scenes of sexual violence.
The latest national and international news from BBC Radio 4.
It's 150 years since the British research ship Challenger sailed around the world, opening up the wonders of the ocean to science.  What could the next 150 years reveal?
The latest weather forecast.
News, analysis and comment from BBC Radio 4.
10/11. Impulse control disorders are a common side effect of dopamine agonist drugs - so why are they so hard to talk about?
Brian tries his hand at matchmaking, and Helen has the time of her life.
Kerry's life is falling apart. She turns to her identical twin for help. What happens next is very far from what she'd been hoping for.
They wriggle and writhe in the earth beneath us, surely, we'd be fine if they vanished? Alan Davies looks beneath our feet deep into the soil and the hard workers who live there.
Kathy Clugston and the team visit the Ninewells Community Garden in Dundee, while delving into the GQT Postbag.
Nia has never believed in the supernatural. Until now. Short story by Lisa Zahra, read by Kimberley Nixon.
Matthew Bannister tells the life stories of people who have recently died, from the rich and famous to unsung but significant.
Matthew Syed hears from a metal singer whose scream gave her an outlet for complex emotions. Through her story, he examines societal pressures on women's voices.
News and current affairs, reporting on breaking stories and summing up the day's headlines.
National and international news from BBC Radio 4.
8/8. Andy Zaltzman is joined by panellists Simon Evans, Ahir Shah, Cindy Yu and Zoe Lyons to break down the week in news.
Helen is in reflective mood, and Chris and Hannah are looking for a challenge.
Composers Debbie Wiseman and Jay Capperauld join Anna and Jeffrey to add five more tracks to the playlist.
Topical discussion posing questions to a panel of political and media personalities.
The Metropolitan police force was branded 'institutionally racist', the city of Rio de Janeiro was founded by the Portuguese and the first Grand National was run at Aintree.
Justine Greening, Martin Gurri, Sophie Scott-Brown, Peter Hyman and Thomas Simpson explore the place of authority in society and culture today.
In depth reporting, intelligent analysis and breaking news from a global perspective.
5/5. A love story based on the lives of the author's great-grandparents, who married in 1878. Forced to return to Cardiff, Ellen and Samuel face poverty and racism.
Join Americast for insights and analysis on what's happening inside Trump's White House.
News, views and features on today's stories in Parliament.
